website_summaries.verdict: Perfect size for dogs to move around with 16 square feet of enclosure area and 5 height options.
pros: Version with a door contains a double latch for additional security
Black finish on the panels will look good for a long time, even when used every day
Extremely easy assembly and pops apart quickly for transport
cons: Must purchase optional top to make the playpen usable for cats or dogs who can jump easily

customer_reviews.title: NO NO NO! Dangerous!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT PURCHASE THIS PRODUCT!!!!!! We got this for our puppy French Bulldog, my husband and I went to set it up when my finger came in contact with something RAZOR sharp, thank goodness I wasn’t making a sweeping motion, otherwise it would have sliced me open! Upon further inspection, there were many, many more razor sharp edges. This literally could be deadly to any animal left alone and unattended due to the possibility of many lacerations. I am shocked this is even still on the market and will be calling Amazon about removal of this product!!!
customer_reviews.author: ChristyD

customer_reviews.title: Unconventional Use for this!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this!!! I put it around my Christmas tree so my dogs can't mess with it!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Works for My Use
customer_reviews.text: This is working great for my dog. He is able to run around in the back yard without a chance of escaping the yard since the yard where I am staying is not entirely closed in. I have also used the pen on the concrete while I am cutting the grass to keep him out of harms way.
customer_reviews.author: ertigers

customer_reviews.title: Pointless, worthless...  opens easily with a few bumps because of design flaw
customer_reviews.text: The pins to lock the door are very short. There isn't a little hook to keep the latches closed. So, it just takes a little bumping, and the door pops open. My dog is only restrained for about 15 minutes, then is free. The whole point of the pen is to keep the dog inside. The manufacturer cheaped out on a tiny detail, making the product worthless. All it would have taken was a hook on the end hat keeps the pin from sliding out, standard on pretty much anything else... But, no. Not here. If your dog has two brain cells to rub together and wants out, this pen will not do a thing for you.
customer_reviews.author: Gnarlythotep

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous!
customer_reviews.text: We just received this fence and are setting it up to protect our one year old from some things in our living room that he shouldn’t get into. As I was setting it up, it actually pierced my finger and I then noticed that all of the metal connections on the fence have tiny shards of metal hanging from them. Not very safe for people or pets.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsey J. Mutrie

customer_reviews.title: Too easy to escape.
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to set up and very sturdy (only reasons I gave it two stars): unfortunately, my 8 week old Maltipoo can climb out due to the horizontal bars being so close together. I bought this in hopes of not using a crate; I ended up having to buy a crate after all. I will be sending this back after I find another solution. I'm including a photo with my review.
customer_reviews.author: O. Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Watch out for return shipping fees!
customer_reviews.text: I regret this purchase. Amazon wants $14 to return the item. (So much for being a Prime member.) I wanted a pen I could move around as needed. It is possible to move this pen, but it is cumbersome and unwieldy. Prepare to pinch your fingers. I cannot risk this on the hardwood floors even with the plastic clips on the bottom. Those might be useful for stabilization but they seem like a big damage risk to me. This will be going outside and the search for an indoor pen continues.
customer_reviews.author: Dimochka

customer_reviews.title: Removable Dog Containment System
customer_reviews.text: Price at our local pet discount store was $89.99. Needed two and paid $59 for each on Amazon. I needed a solution to keep my new Queensland in the garage so drilled some holes in the concrete and used rigid gas pipe and Velcro to attach the fence material. The whole thing pulls out and folds up to pull my vehicle in. I plan on adding more holes inside the garage to allow both my dogs to come in through the side door and keep them contained while pulling in and out. Gate work as expected and the strength of the fencing is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Mokelumne Jones

customer_reviews.title: Nice, big and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This is huge and easy to fold. Im using this for potty training and it has been helping me a lot. It came assembled so that was helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah T

customer_reviews.title: SPACIOUS
customer_reviews.text: I never leave reviews on Amazon but this was amazing and I wanted to share. This is exactly what I needed.. I work full time but wanted a puppy, we all know puppies are a lot of work, I ordered this so on the days I don't have friends over and helping with the puppy she has more space and I feel better about leaving to work. It gives them plenty of space and I'm so happy I ordered it. I highly recommend it for anyone who hates leaving their puppy in the crate.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Potty training so much easier. But ?durable?
customer_reviews.text: House training was once a nightmare. Pup lunged at everything. Sniffed/dug/ate instead of getting busy. If video posts, you’ll see how distracted she can get. Pen keeps her contained and there’s no need for leash. Artificial grass (Goasis Lawn 35 mm height.  ) helps her focus. She’s finally getting the idea she’s out there to do business. Have had for less than a month. Small areas of rust developed quickly, within days, but pen has always been outside. Also, 2 clips broke. Not sure of the material, but it is brittle and not metal. Easy enough to replace with cable ties, but still slightly disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: We are using this mainly to hold our pup and ...
customer_reviews.text: We are using this mainly to hold our pup and keep her safe while we step away for a few moments. We expanded it to its full size and left home. What do you do when your escape artist uses the grates to climb out??? Secure plastic sheets to each panel so your pup cannot climb up the grates! Problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: Sunflower

customer_reviews.title: Get a taller one when in doubt - my 5 lbs 3 month old puppy climbs out.
customer_reviews.text: I've been generally happy with this product until a few days ago. Like usual, I put my puppy in the pen and went to bed. When I woke up I found him running around in the house, chewing on the electrical wires. I yelled at my poor boyfriend for letting him out without supervision. It turned out my puppy's legs grew just long enough for the vertical spacing, and he climbs out of the pen like it's a ladder. I just ordered 24" x 42". I am hoping he won't be able to climb out of this one. If he does, I'm officially registering him as a circus dog.
customer_reviews.author: SVA

customer_reviews.title: Every pet owner needs this.
customer_reviews.text: This pen is a lifesaver. Having a new puppy is stressful enough without having to watch them constantly. Sometimes you need some personal time and with this pen you can make a perfect puppy safe area for your puppy to relax in. I have it placed in a corner of my house so she has some more space to play! Also it is a great deal! I looked everywhere, target, Walmart, tj max, pets smart, pet co, and nobody had a nice quality pen for this very reasonable price!!
customer_reviews.author: Brock & Jess

customer_reviews.title: Used only 3 hours, dog escaped!
customer_reviews.text: I read good review, so decided to buy. We set up the pento attached with the L- size create, unfortunately we didnt take the picture. We put our female puppy inside the pen, she was 11 weeks old, 22-23 lbs.and we went out for 3 hrs. When we back home, she was already out ! The pen still attached with the crate :( locks were not loose. Beside this incident, I also found the material wasnt si good. It was much thinner than I thought.
customer_reviews.author: Clary

customer_reviews.title: Great playpen for an active rabbit
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unsure really how tall, spacious, and sturdy it would actually be. But based on the reviews, I knew it would be a good choice, and it really was. The pen is heavy enough that I don't even need to spikes to keep it in the ground. Also, it is high enough so that a pretty decent jumping rabbit cannot jump over the pen. He goes out of his cage just to get some room to run around and jump around when he gets too crammed inside his cage in the house. It is a great pen. If you have doubts, you won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Kahos923

customer_reviews.title: Great rabbitat pen.
customer_reviews.text: This was just what I wanted. There was an inconvenient delay in delivery. Which made housing my Holland lops challenging until it arrivesd. It was supposed to be on a Friday but it didn't show up until the following Monday. Anyway. Works just as expected. I wish the gate somehow was moveable, but I guess that would change the structure and make it more expensive. For the price you can't beat it. I've checked a ton of places. Pet stores way expensive, Walmart, target, blah blah, everyone was noticeably higher. I actually ordered a second one so that I don't have to move their indoor rabbitat when we go outside to play with them.
customer_reviews.author: aaustad

customer_reviews.title: Yoga mat for puppy proofing
customer_reviews.text: I was racking my brain how to make this playpen safe for my floors and my pup’s paws Before I pup proofed it, she cut her paw trying to get out. I bought a yoga mat from Walmart and some zip ties and proofed the top and bottom. It works really well. Doesn’t scratch my floors anymore and she stopped trying to get out
customer_reviews.author: K. Ngo

customer_reviews.title: Finish is Rough
customer_reviews.text: This is my fourth purchase of a MidWest Homes Zinc/Gold playpen for my dog. All three previous purchases have been good quality. The fourth purchase has inconsistent color and finish. I have provided a picture of an earlier purchase and a photo of the last purchase. The color of the new one is inconsistent and the finish in spots is rough to the touch. It functions just the same, but the quality is not the same as my three previous purchases.
customer_reviews.author: Waterscape

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Just what we were looking for. We wanted an area for our 8-week old puppy to romp in if we temporarily needed to leave the room; if we were cooking; etc. I clip the door to her crate open, and let her come and go as she wishes. I was hoping the "snaps" that help to stabilize the sections would be more secure, but that is my only concern. I used half of them for the top, and half on the bottom to protect the hardwood floor. Love that it has a door for easy access; and it is very easy to configure into whatever shape you wish. Altogether, a very satisfied customer.
customer_reviews.author: ksf

customer_reviews.title: Quality product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to potty train my dog outside. The material is good quality and rust free. Very sturdy and flexible. It makes potty training my dog so easy.Love it. Would definitely recommend it to someone looking for quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Gunjan

customer_reviews.title: Serves its purpose
customer_reviews.text: This serves its purpose as to have somewhere to keep the puppies while i am busy around the house. I am trying to train them so this is going to be their area. My husband did add some more support to them by adding some beams on the bottom of it, just because i feel the puppies will get big and eventually try to jump up on it but it isnt going anywhere. I would suggest that if you were to keep them in there for long periods of time to maybe get some kind of baby bumpers on the bottom. Just my thought. But overall i am pleased. Will add a second review after using this for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Amy T

customer_reviews.title: Solid Rabbit Cage for the price. Well made.
customer_reviews.text: Bought the 48" High model for my rabbit. I have two cats which one is definitely sketchy in the predatorial type so I did not want to leave a chance of keeping it opening so I purchased the optional lid. Very impressed with price, value and construction. The Assembly instructions are fairly vague. If it wasn't for the pictures and me being semi-intelligent when it comes to assembly I'd probably have a hard time. I would definitely recommend this as 48 inches high enough to prevent a bunny rabbit from jumping over. It comes with a bunch of steaks if you wanted to put this outside and have it not move for applications such as a dog
customer_reviews.author: Rocco-the-Retro-Repairman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our furbaby after surgery!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this exercise pen to help keep my Bichon Frise confined after she was spayed. It was a perfect place for her to recuperate when she couldn't be on my lap. We set it up in our living room and it is really big! I am able to fit her crate, feed and water bowls, her favorite quilt, her pillow and her favorite toys in the pen and there is still room for her to walk around. We'll also use this even after she's healed to give her a safe place to play while we work outside on our farm or go camping, etc. Highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: Debra

customer_reviews.title: Great quality play pen
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for little puppy and securely kept him overnight. I liked the gold/brass color, it was easy to spot a mess or dirt to clean. 4 hooks included, those were extra helpful to connect and attach to the metal crate. Versatile enough I have tried several different formations ( hexagon, T shape, square, etc).It is bit heavy for me to move or carry around though. I wish it comes with some ropes or handle so I can carry it for any outing activity. Overall I am satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Cecil

customer_reviews.title: Versatile, easy to use exercise pen
customer_reviews.text: Thrilled with this choice. Worked exactly as described and as I hoped. Very flexible/versatile. Originally used it in a square shape, 48“ x 48“. Eventually I added a two panel extension but used it to divide the pen in half for our two puppies. Then a few weeks later, I used the pen totally opened up as a fence to cordon off a portion of the kitchen. This is a great product that changes with your puppy and has many uses. Stabilization was addressed by purchasing additional swivel snap hooks from Amazon (these:  . I attached the crates and open crate doors to the walls of the pen.
customer_reviews.author: KareninStLouis

customer_reviews.title: DONT ORDER "GOLD"
customer_reviews.text: This review is not directed towards Amazon in any way, but intended for MidWest Homes. I really needed an enclosure for my new pup and wanted to go with this company because of their positive reviews. Unfortunately, the black playpens would not ship for one to two months and I could not wait that long. The only other option was gold. My wife and I agreed that gold would be okay, but this is not gold... More like burnt bronze as it gradually changes from yellow to green to purple... Not to sure if this company has a quality control department, but judging by the product I received I'd say they don't. Quite dissatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: TravStef

customer_reviews.title: Well made and fully functional as a tempory kennel
customer_reviews.text: Comes fully assembled and "accordioned" into a box. Light enough for one person to carry easily. When it's erected (in a matter of minutes) it maintains it's shape by plastic clips that slip down over adjoining strait sections. Needed such a temporary kennel to contain an "active" puppy for a few months before training could be done effectively. It's now in the attic for use during dog trial events and other such "temporary need" uses. Checked prices of used kennels before purchasing and this one was less expensive with much less bother than tracking down advertising owners and driving some distance to see what they had for sale.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy

customer_reviews.title: Overall gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. It's pretty lightweight so it moves pretty easily, more so on hardwood floor than carpet, but had to add some reinforcements to keep the panels from sliding around if the dog decided to push it. I have a 12 lb kangaroo (Chihuahua mix) that jumps very high so I got the 36" with 8 panels and the door. Luckily he doesn't know how to climb. I feel like if I had a bigger/larger dog this playpen might not be strong enough to Outlast them (but what do I know about bigger dogs). It's easy to set up and the door has two locks otherwise it would definitely be too flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Sam11

customer_reviews.title: Great pen. We attached it to a Midwest crate ...
customer_reviews.text: Great pen. We attached it to a Midwest crate bought through Amazon to allow for more space for our Labrador while we are at work (the cat is showing off).
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Life saver! Puppy can’t get in trouble and you keep your sanity
customer_reviews.text: Love this puppy sitter! I move it all over the house and outside onto the porch or grass if I’m doing something that keeps me from supervising puppy. As you can see by picture my full grown golden retriever likes hanging out in there too with the lab puppy. It’s very roomy and airy! they don’t feel like they’re in jail. Enough room for potty pad (although my puppy won’t use them) toys and a small blanket area. My only suggestion is to go buy two additional heavy duty clips- the 4 that come with fence are flimsy. Also don’t bother getting with door. Just adds weight and makes unwieldy. Just undo clip to let in and out.
customer_reviews.author: milowe35

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn’t recommend for puppies
customer_reviews.text: I’m a very handy person and for whatever reason I could not build this cage. I have a 2 month old puppy and he was able to climb out of it after 10 minutes of being inside. so I don’t use it at all. There’s no point when my puppy is just going to climb out. I’m really disappointed I wasted my money on this. I’m going to have to buy a cage that’s closed on the top.
customer_reviews.author: Ileana

customer_reviews.title: Great product, bigger than I thought,but can be used inside and out and made into different shapes
customer_reviews.text: Bigger than I thought... with that being said, this can be configured in different ways to suit your needs. My teacup Chihuahua needs a smaller area than this so I will be taking out panels. It comes with stakes so it can be staked in the ground outdoors. I'm really looking forward to using this for outside. It folds great.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 4 with 2 pups

customer_reviews.title: You probably don't need the big one
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these for my two big dogs (70lbs +, Rhodesian Ridgeback and a Black lab) to make it easier to let them be outside when camping and not trapped in the camper when I need to work. Unless your dog is actively aggressive or an escape artist you do not need the 48" fence. This thing looks like I'm setting up a FOB to storm the campground lol. They are strong, well made, but I wish I had gotten the 36" or 42" at most.
customer_reviews.author: ANDREC

customer_reviews.title: Use as a Crate
customer_reviews.text: I use this instead of a crate for my German Shepard puppy. I secured it to the walls of my room and bought a top for it so my puppy couldn’t climb out. I also drape a blanket over the top so it seems more like a den. I like the additional space it gives my dog to move around when I’m not home. While it doesn’t have a door it is really easy to unclip it to open and I haven’t felt the need to get one with a gate. I wouldn’t t it without securing it in some way if you have a strong dog.
customer_reviews.author: Chloe

customer_reviews.title: Think outside the pet corral idea
customer_reviews.text: I used this fence to shield my cotton plants from deer. I wanted to grow it to spin. It is not growing very well, but that is a function of the soil, I think. I may use this in the orchard next spring to protect a young tree from the deer. The deer won't jump into small enclosures, they say, and they certainly have not jumped in to eat my tiny cotton plants. They had no compunction about eating the tops of my sunflowers, which had no protection. So, if your dog doesn't need a fence, you can use this one to keep the deer from eating your favorite plants.
customer_reviews.author: Xander and Patrick's Nana

customer_reviews.title: Door is NOT secure
customer_reviews.text: We have a large rabbit and bought three of these to use as a large enclosure. After a few weeks we saw via camera that his big head was stuck between the wires in the fencing. Come to find out he learned how to shake the door open and was trying to squeeze back inside the pen. Thankfully a neighbor was able to save him, however I was shocked at how easy it is to get the gate door to open just by lightly shaking it. We are adding 1/4" mesh to prevent him from getting stuck and additional clamps to keep the gate open. See attached video
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Rabbit Fencing
customer_reviews.text: I use these to keep my rabbits corralled. I have bunnies on my deck and this pen system keeps them from escaping. I have house rabbits that are contained within these pens and, also, because rabbits chew electrical cords, I have my tV and electronics fenced off to keep them out. Otherwise, they'd be having a tasty snack at the expense of our tV or surround sound! Great product, great quality. I will buy again if the necessity arrises.
customer_reviews.author: Rabbit Mom

customer_reviews.title: I recommend buying 2
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend buying two. Otherwise the dogs are stepping all over the pee pad. Two gives you an area to have the pee pads all by theirselves, far away from food and beds. I use it for my older dogs. It cuts down on “accidents” that tend to happen with age. They will even go into the area and lay down on their own. It does have a little step over area that one of my old girls couldn’t get over, so I flipped it upside down so she could walk in and out. It’s still short enough for me to step into for cleaning and care.
customer_reviews.author: MamaHen

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommended gate. We bought this for our two rabbits to be able to run around inside this winter, but still be contained. It comes assembled and nicely boxed, just unfold and you’re set! It folds flat for easy storage and is sturdy. We got the one with the door which is a nice feature not having to climb over the gate.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Soooo flimsy!!! Not durable whatsoever!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for a litter of puppies that my dog had. This pen is very flimsy. The pups aren’t big to begin with and they can jump and move the pen around. I had to put bungee cords in and around to help with durability. There’s no way a bigger dog could use this, they’d knock it over. The door also opens and closes crooked, I have to physically line up the holes with the latches in order to get it to close properly.
customer_reviews.author: BH

customer_reviews.title: Don't pay more than $30 for the 36" high
customer_reviews.text: I bought this same kennel a few times already. I paid $30 for it. Right after I purchased it, the price went up to almost $50. The previous one I had paid for was also $30. The price fluctuates throughout the year between $30-$50. I had to wait about 6 months for it to come back down. There really is no reason for price fluctuations other than greed. With that being said, this kennel withstands staying outdoors year round. I use it for various animals, from very small chickens to rabbits. I place a cover on it to protect from overhead predators and it keeps them just fine. Sturdy and so far, no rust.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzie T

customer_reviews.title: Stabilizers don’t work, everyone says so
customer_reviews.text: This is certainly one of the most popular exercise pens for dogs. But I really think that MidWest can do better. Literally not a single reviewer praises the stabilizers. It’s hard to maintain the octagonal or even square shape. I imagine that a good engineer could figure out how to stabilize the shape, yet MidWest has not invested the time or effort to do that. A more superior product would also offer a package deal with a customized playpen floor cover (waterproof pad or a plastic tray similar to the one for the crate).
customer_reviews.author: PediatricianMom

customer_reviews.title: so happy we bought this instead of a regular gate!
customer_reviews.text: We took this apart into halves. One half separates our kitchen from our dining room to keep the puppy in the kitchen while I'm at work (we have a doggy door so she can go outside as needed). The other half is used in the garage to keep her away from our garbage cans. So far, despite trying, she hasn't been able to climb, knock over, or jump over the fence (and trust me, she's a jumper!). This worked so much better than expensive gates that may have damaged my walls/cupboards, and it is easy to fold up and slide next to our fridge when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbi Randall

customer_reviews.title: Great product at a bargain price!
customer_reviews.text: This pen has been a lifesaver with our new puppy. Easy to put up. We have an open concept 1st floor so he is able to be around the family but still confined. We keep his bed and toys there with him. The door is convenient for both the dog and people to get in and out. The black wire blends in nicely so it doesn't look as out of place. We quickly decided to lay down a heavy duty tarp underneath to protect the hardwood floor from the puppy's scratching as well as potty accidents. We have left him in there unsupervised for a few hours with no issues. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jerzey Lady

customer_reviews.title: Divider doesn't come down far enough posing an injury concern
customer_reviews.text: Our puppy tends to keep his foot under the divider when he's in there and inevitably tries to get up or move and gets his foot caught under the divider and yelps. This has happened 3 times in a matter of 4 weeks. We do not use a mat in the crate based on advice from experts expressing concerns of a chew and swallow hazard. The divider needs to be configurable to allow it to be flush with the tray, preventing the puppy's foot from slipping under there. We are considering putting a mat now to avoid this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Geek Daddy

customer_reviews.title: Plastic Clips Don't Stay On - Don't buy - unstable joints, doesn't prevent movement or protect floor
customer_reviews.text: Used five stars to get this message to people reading the good reviews: There are plastic clips that are supposed to attach at the top or bottom of each panel joint. This provides the stability for each angle or straight connection between any two panels, prevents the pen from moving or sliding on the floor and protects the floor. But these clips do not stay on. As you attempt to re-attach one, it disrupts other clips and they fall off. Don't buy if you want stability, to prevent movement & have floor protection. Door step height is good. Good visibility.
customer_reviews.author: Bodhi

customer_reviews.title: Great fence for a bun
customer_reviews.text: Its a pretty good fence, folds easily enough and it adjustable. I bought this sized fence because i googled how tall a pen should be for a bunny, and bought the recommended size. Turns out its entirely too short since my bunny is a hopper, so I would recommend getting a few sizes up from what I got (at least 36 inches, 42 just to be safe tho) In summary, definitely buy this pen, I dont use the stakes since we never take her outside anymore (thanks to the rabbit virus going around) but the stakes are sturdy and good quality, and they gave me a lot of them.
customer_reviews.author: Cierra

customer_reviews.title: perfect for giving my rabbit some freedom in the yard
customer_reviews.text: My rabbit loves it ! I put a cage in the middle and a big square of wire fencing over the top. My 2 big dogs can not get into the pen so my rabbit is free to eat grass and do bunny things to his heart's content. I did however learn quickly that I had to also add a square of the wire fencing under the pen because rabbits to like to dig burrows. I highly recommend this pen. It is easy to access. It has been in the yard for months now and has not shown any sign of rust. I was worried he would be able to jump out but it has not been a problem.
customer_reviews.author: taye ford

customer_reviews.title: Foldable Pet Pen
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time I have ever bought on before and I think it is the neatest thing since sliced bread. All the panels are already connected which is super nice. It folds up really nice. There is a latch thing to keep your pen folded together which is great cause who wants to deal with a pen flinging open when you have your hands full. I honestly didn't read before hand that they come with little extra things which was so exciting in the end. By the end of this review I just want to say that this purchase was a very great investment.
customer_reviews.author: Harlie

customer_reviews.title: Not for indoor use.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for 8 week and 14 week old half sisters - white German shepherd puppies. We went out to do laundry checked on them after an hour and they were fine. Another hour later came home and pen was knocked over, puppies out, and poo smeared everywhere. The only reason I'm not giving this 1 star is that we did not test it outside with the grounding rods so maybe it would work better outside if firmly secured with the rods in the ground. However if you want this for indoor use do not waste your money unless you have an inactive dog.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. & Mrs.

customer_reviews.title: High Quality, Low Price
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this pen. Heavier gauge then Many small dog pens. Really like that the doors extends to top of pen so no obstruction at top of door for larger dogs or stepping inside of pen when door is open. Has 2 door latches. Tight hinge so door stays open if you want which I really like to provide access as our Chihuahua likes to go in to sleep or chew her bones. Comes with 8 plastic feet ( sort of a split tubes) that prevents floor scratches and can keep the sides straight. Also comes with a set of heavy gauge U shaped rods for holding to a lawn.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great pen for a dog
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this pen for a year and it works great for our dog. It stays upright. It's easy to fold, and it's sturdy enough for even a big dog. Our dog is small, but my son's dog is 45 pounds. We sometimes put him in the pen to separate the dogs, and he's never damaged it or knocked it over. It's a great are and my god likes it so much he sometimes goes to sleep there without our putting him into it. Highly recommended. It's also a barrier to keep the dog out of the dining and living rooms.
customer_reviews.author: Ramblin Man

customer_reviews.title: Works with a caveat
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to keep two puppies safe when we're busy fixing dinner, etc. It was easy to put together and sturdy enough. The only problem is, the crossbars allow a determined puppy to climb. One of our 9-week old puppies is really adventurous and climbed up and over. Most of the time we just pop her back in, but once she got her paw stuck and, if we had not been in the room, I'm afraid that she would have broken a leg. We still use it but only if we're there to watch them.
customer_reviews.author: ae in vir

customer_reviews.title: its ok but not great
customer_reviews.text: its ok but not great, I have a 9 week old Pomsky so the hight is ok for now (I got the 24in). It has many shape configurations put you can not lock the shape if that makes sense. My puppy pushes the panels with her but or every time she stands, so I have to constantly reshape the playpen to the way I want it, an easy solution will be to have the bottom part with a non slippery material so it stays in shape. overall it serves its purpose of not having my puppy running around the house but it definitely needs improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Bea

customer_reviews.title: Rickety Chinese-made Junk
customer_reviews.text: Once assembled, the whole thing wobbles and feels like it'll collapse. if your dog yawns. It's LOUD - all that metal squeaking. TONS of loose-jointed play. The sides bow in and out about 30 degrees each way. The instructions are horrible, referring to numbered illustrations that do not exist. Avoid this dollar store product.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Fabbro

customer_reviews.title: Loving it so far
customer_reviews.text: Quick delivery. With in 15 minutes we had it unboxed and attached to the crate. My daughter was not impressed with the latches for the door, but I think they will be fine. She believes the puppies will be able to flip the handle up to open them. We will see. We folded 2 panels back together to shorten the pen size. We love that when it’s time to change the pads we fold the pen to one side. Then put it back when finished.
customer_reviews.author: SArdoin

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied Customer, Five Star Product
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this product five stars. It's super easy to assemble straight out of the box. I bought this for my dwarf Lionhead and it's perfect for us. I attached this straight to his bunny hutch and left it partially open, closing off half of my office space. He loves all the extra space and I love that he's somewhat contained to one super large area. I'm also looking forward to using this outside and getting him some fresh air. The ground stakes and pen is pretty sturdy for being lightweight. Overall, I"m extremely happy with this purchase and I'm considering ordering a second one to protect our indoor baseboards/trim, as these seem to be appealing to mini Snuffleupagus.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Marie

customer_reviews.title: Crazy puppy - buy this!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot talk this item up enough. My puppy is crazy (good crazy) but it’s hard to do anything when he is running in front of my feet. So I got this play pen in the hopes that it could keep him occupied In a controlled environment so I can do normal things like work, cleaning, use the bathroom without worrying about him eating or destroying something. I also put him in there if I need to leave the house for a couple hours. He loves it (holds everything he needs), I love it. Win-win.
customer_reviews.author: Gizmo’s Human

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product at a fantastic price
customer_reviews.text: I don’t normally write product reviews for products I really enjoy. I typically only write buyer beware type reviews but I’m making an exception for this. I bought this kennel for our ducks who are still too small to free range. It was exactly what I needed. It’s super easy to setup. I have rheumatoid arthritis, sometimes these things can be beyond my dexterity. I didn’t need help at all. It feels super sturdy. Out of the box The door is aligned perfectly making for smooth openings and closures. It would work perfectly for puppy training as well. You can’t beat the quality for the cost. I’m impressed. So impressed in fact I’m ordering a second one.
customer_reviews.author: ImBeyonceAlways

customer_reviews.title: okay
customer_reviews.text: I bought (3) of these to make a larger play area by combining them. Setup was pretty simple - just unfold, latch together and stake in. I do not plan on moving mine. In my configuration I found the sides were much too floppy and unstable so I use metal garden stakes for support. I also used plastic ties to hold sections more securely. For my purpose of a large play area, I would not buy this again... too floppy. If used in a single configuration or perhaps other layouts, it might be better. I expected more from it and probably should have gone with a larger chain link type kennel.
customer_reviews.author: VelocityTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Great for rabbits
customer_reviews.text: I use this as a separation fence for my two rabbits. They can see each other and interact without the dominance routine. Since they have an entire living room sized space, I simply folded one panel on each side (wall to wall) and they are held with medium rocks. I move and manipulate the “fence” at least twice a day for cleaning, feeding, and various other things. It is incredibly easy. I don’t use the door panel because it is up against the wall to fit the room. The wires are gentle on their teeth, or it at least doesn’t damage the teeth and they haven’t damaged the wire chewing it. I definitely recommend this for bunnies.
customer_reviews.author: snscuster

customer_reviews.title: Great space a rabbit
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. We use this inside for our mostly free-range pet rabbit as her enclosure during the night. Plenty of space for water, food, litter box, a cardboard box to hide in or perch on, etc. When she is impatient for us to let her out in the morning she starts tugging on the sides, but she's never toppled it. Enough room we don't feel bad that she's trapped in there overnight.
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: So good...I bought another!
customer_reviews.text: So happy I bought this. It has made having a new puppy so much easier. I initially had it set up as a small pin for when we could had to leave the room and needed to keep her safe for a couple minutes. I ended up spreading it across the room and blocking her from leaving the room and venturing down the hall. I also use it as a pin when we take her up to my classroom. (Prepping for virtual summer school!) I am waiting on my second one to arrive. I got tired of packing it up, so I decided to get one to keep in my car.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Great X Pen for a Border Collie
customer_reviews.text: I use this outdoors when I have my dog with me. It makes a great pen where he can wait while I get things done, while we are camping, or while I am putting the kayak into the water for his boating pleasure. My only compaint is that the door piece was bent when I got it just a bit. I have left it as it doesn't change the integrity of the Xpen itself. THis is a great tool for anyone wanting to enjoy outdoor time with their dog but don't want to let him run off-leash
customer_reviews.author: Hockey Chick

customer_reviews.title: Alright, but not for me.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this folding kennel for our two small dogs (York is and Shih Tzu) that were not potty trained for more room than their small kennel. We have hard-wood flooring in our home, and the kennel slid around nearly folding up on our dogs. The kennel come with hard plastic holders that are suppose to keep the kennel from folding up, but they were not very effective. I would recommend if purchasing that you purchase a top for the kennel, my Yorkie could climb out of the kennel resulting in injuring her leg jumping off the top. I resorted back to my dogs small kennels to ensure their safety, and more stability.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy & Brandi Moore

customer_reviews.title: pretty and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: very easy to assemble and i like the gold look, less garish than the typical black. I used it to block off my patio and I’m gonna get another one so i can link them together and fence off the whole thing. I have a corgi and I got the medium height because looking at the picture, it seemed pretty easy for her to jump over the small but the medium is way taller than it looks like in the picture. I guess better safe than sorry but if you have a low-rider dog (unless it’s a lhasa, those things can jump!) i think you’ll be fine with the cheaper, shorter size
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Santoro

customer_reviews.title: Easy to escape
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this pen for our Golden Retriever. He easily figured out how to open the pen by biting and squeezing on the bars with his jaws, which allowed him to unhook the small lock and then jiggle the wire bars until the latches slipped out of lock position. If you have a larger, smart dog this will not do the trick. He didn't jump or knock over, he simply used his brain to manipulate the product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well made, good for indoor or outdoor use.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for outdoor use as a divider to keep our male and female ducks seperated in their run. Works great and the gate panel is handy so we can step through (though it is just as easy to step over). So far 6 months out in the sun and rain and it's still not showing any signs of rust. Super easy to set up and it comes with pins so you can secure it into the ground as well as clips to help keep the panels straight at the top. Would work great for puppies or any other small critters as a playpen.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied customer
customer_reviews.text: Just to let you know, this is the 3rd pen we have ordered from you! We love it!!!! The price is unbelievably reasonable for being so durable and so beneficial for a puppy. Much better than a crate. She loves it as her own space. We also used one to prevent her from gong in certain areas of our home but yet she has a lot of area to play. My husband and I are over 65 and have forgotten how challenging a puppy can be. You have made it so much easier for us! Thank You So Much! Debi Clark
customer_reviews.author: Mama C

customer_reviews.title: Sweet
customer_reviews.text: This is great! My dog HATES her kennel but she can’t be trusted to roam the house while I’m working (chews furniture and scratches the walls). I think because this doesn’t have a top, she doesn’t feel as closed in. The plastic stability pieces are kind of a pain to put on but that’s really the only down side. I’ll be ordering another one without a door to add on to give her more room.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and easy to use and portable.
customer_reviews.text: We have ordered another one of these, since we have more than one home. They are easy to fold up and move. Not bulky when laid flat, not to heavy and very sturdy. I would recommend these for anyone with small to medium size dogs. I can easily bend over the pen to add food and water to dishes, pick up toys and bedding. If I only want one dog to exit, it is easy to reach in and pick her up. The gate is easy to open and close. Literally took it out of the box and set it up in minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: sturdy, easy to assemble, easy to store
customer_reviews.text: Extremely easy to assemble you literally just unfold it and clip the opening shut! Also comes with stakes to keep it firm in the ground however I don’t even bother using those. Perfect for easy stowing under the bed or behind the door because it folds so easily flat and comes with this clip sort of thing to keep it folded flat for storage. Very sturdy, I kinda lean against it a little when I sit in it with my little chinchilla for yard time and it feels relatively strong (I weigh 250lbs mind you) I have absolutely no complaints it’s absolutely everything it’s advertised to be and does what I want it to do with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Assemble and Transport
customer_reviews.text: My sister asked me to order this kennel for her puppies. She is a registered professional breeder with the AKC. We wanted this for the puppies to be outside and play in, and for when the owners come to pick up their puppies. This honestly was the easiest assembly of a kennel. Ever. My 11 year old nephew set it up. It also looks a lot larger in person compared to the comparison photos. We are very very pleased with it. We purchased the kennel with the optional door, and it makes getting them in and out a breeze without having to lean over the sides. Great kennel for the price point.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: So useful and so cheap compared to others
customer_reviews.text: The 30 inch is perfectly tall for my dogs which they are mid size. I use this outside for my puppy and my 4 year old schnauzers.I the like walk in door to clean and organize everything as well as let the dogs in and out. Indoors, A lot of you say that it moves around easily,have you used your rubber stoppers? Sometimes I leave the gate open for my puppy so he can walk in or out freely except at night time. I noticed he is now walking in there to eat and use the restroom and even go to sleep. I think he appreciates his own space because my daughter could be a little much at times lol
customer_reviews.author: Monique

customer_reviews.title: Not Escape Proof.
customer_reviews.text: This was bought to contain my 3 month old 3-4 lb Shitzu/Chihuahua mix puppy with the intent that she could be present in the house while I was at work and not be completely confined. Well, she was able to escape it on multiple occassions...even after I put heavy boxes all the way around and against it. I think she was able to somehow get underneath it and escape. Now all I use it for is a play pen outside so my two small dogs can watch me mow the yard.
customer_reviews.author: AKPopp

customer_reviews.title: All the pieces do not work
customer_reviews.text: How can you screw up a metal crate, but this company did it. Maybe I am to stupid to figure it out but the plastic clips that are supposed to go between two pieces to keep the panels in a straight line do not fit. After an hour of struggling I had to give up. The opening in the clip is too small for the clamp that holds the panels together. Otherwise it is okay, just several wire panels clipped together. The clips are shown in the pictures but not assembled to the pen.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy A

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY - Color Oxidized and Rubs Off!!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot stress this enough - do not waste your time and money on this playpen! I should have trusted the other reviews that said that the coloring was off, because mine (I ordered the gold one) came completely oxidized (i.e. the "gold" coloring had turned yellow/green/purple) and was rubbing off onto my fingers! This is incredibly dangerous for a puppy that chews/licks everything! Save yourself the hassle of having to return this and buy a different playpen!!
customer_reviews.author: Claire

customer_reviews.title: Good with Modifications
customer_reviews.text: I have a puppy that hates her traditional crate. This is a much better solution and she’s happy to be in there. The only problem is I am using it inside so I cannot use the included stakes. It was quite flimsy on its own on my marble floors. So as others have done, I added small pvc pipe with zip ties around the base of the enclosure to stabilize it. It is now a great solution while house training! Very happy with it after the needed modifications.
customer_reviews.author: KAM

customer_reviews.title: My new babysitter for the cat
customer_reviews.text: This perfect for my calico kitty who is used to being outside about 70% of the time. When we moved I was worried that she would hate being only indoors. This playpen has been amazing in helping her get that outside time, while also staying safe. I use the SPF protective net/shield on top of this so she has sun protection and doesn't jump out. This also comes with the U stakes, which I didn't know until I opened the box. This saved like $8 as I was going to purchase stakes.
customer_reviews.author: Turner

customer_reviews.title: Gives my cats outside time
customer_reviews.text: I use the gate directly outside my door to enable the cats some outside time. I went with a taller gate, unsure if the cats would try jumping or climbing over the gate but that hasn't been an issue; the sound of it shaking startles them enough. I wish the segments weren't connected because the gate is not useful for me, located on the end of the 8-panels. There are shrubs on both sides of my door, so the gate ends up against one of the bushes, or otherwise isn't stable enough to use leaning against the wall.
customer_reviews.author: stray panda

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my chicks safe!
customer_reviews.text: Used this for taking my 3 week old chicks outside for the first time while keeping them safe from predators. I covered it with wire and a sheet for shade and the were kept happy all afternoon. If they were any smaller I would have had to put chicken wire around the bottom but the wire openings were small enough to keep mine from escaping. It comes with metal stakes to keep it from moving so that was a plus. Super easy to set up and fold back into the box and very reasonably priced!
customer_reviews.author: KLD2003

customer_reviews.title: ideal yard gate
customer_reviews.text: I am very very very impressed with this yard gate. The quality, the construction, the height and the stableizers. The only two things i am not impressed with are the rubber stableizers that you put on the top or bottom. They are not flexible or well designed. The other thing is that you can not move it easily when it is up. It practically takes two or more people to move it. Setting it up and taking it down though and transporting it then is ideal.
customer_reviews.author: Ranada in North Carolina

customer_reviews.title: My 10 week old puppy climbed it up and got out
customer_reviews.text: I think it would be better if it got remodeled to make the spaces between the wires smaller so it would not fit the puppy's paws. My 10 week old golden doodle puppy climbed up and got out of it twice and we weren't even around, so that could have caused a disaster if it wasn't noticed soon enough. Also what's really annoying is how long it takes to get the refund for the return, usually I take the item to UPS even unpacked and would get the refund in no time. In this case the seller wants to receive the return first then issue a refund which is taking forever these days.
customer_reviews.author: Ayman S.

customer_reviews.title: Good temp fence
customer_reviews.text: I have two for my Mini-Poodle. A bit flimsy if you try to make two panels straight, but as long as you are angling the panels some as you go it works great. I used some aluminum channel from the hardware store to make braces so I could keep two panels at a time straight and hang the shade panel. I also got some small eyelet screws for his doghouse so I could clip the panels to it. The doghouse is on wheels, so I can put him anywhere. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: jhachtel

customer_reviews.title: Helps with a new puppy, but it has its flaws
customer_reviews.text: I have a 9 week old puppy and this has been a lifesaver. It's useful especially when I'm cooking and can't keep my eye on her. It is slightly heavy so I wouldn't say it's completely easy to fold or travel with. Assembly was okay until I got to the plastic pieces that go on the bottom to help with support and so the floor doesn't get scratched. They were a pain to position right and snap into place. A week after having it, my puppy was able to get one off. Thankfully she didn't choke on it.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie A

customer_reviews.title: Bent and missing parts
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this pen for my standard poodle to help with training. When I opened the box the pen was bend and one of the connecting panels was missing a connecter making the pen fall easy and pop open at the top on at that panel. I used one of the gold clips that came with the pen to connect it and it holds good enough. I did not send it back because I was needing right away for the dog. This would have been a great pen if it was not so bent. and broken. I used it only because I needed it right away.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Did what it needed to
customer_reviews.text: Used for 6 foster puppies. I'd give 5 stars, but I felt misled. This crate can be configured in almost any shape, however, it can't be taken apart. I planned to attach (like a hallway) between 2 crates and couldn't. Unfortunately it didn't link together with any of our 4 crates. I was able to keep a small baby pool inside it during nursing phase and then made it into the puppy pen when the puppies were on solids. Also, the puppies were able to push the sides all over, the plastic clips didn't hold the shape. We mounted wood on the outside with zip strips to maintain the shape.
customer_reviews.author: MichR

customer_reviews.title: Works okay for a calm dog, small space
customer_reviews.text: Works okay and it gives our dog some space around his crate. The playpen is pretty big, but even then it isn't really enough space for a dog to play in unless your dog is very small. Not super sturdy, and a determined dog would easily knock this over (at least without the studs to hold it in place), but works okay if your dog isn't aggressive about getting out. The only problem is the latch that is supposed to keep it closed is pretty low quality, I have no idea how it is supposed to keep the pen closed. I simply used a carabiner to secure it to the crate instead.
customer_reviews.author: Kaan Genc

customer_reviews.title: Holds up after seven years of misuse
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these seven years ago to corral some pet ducklings. The fence has been out in all weather and I've definitely left it outside during a winter or two. It's rusty now but still holds up well. I bought a second one this year to make a bigger fenced in area for this year's ducklings. If you want an animal to have any real space, I'd buy two and connect them. They store totally flat and take up little room. I highly recommend this fence/play yard.
customer_reviews.author: Thoughtful Design

customer_reviews.title: Must buy for all puppy owners!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve setup this MidWest playpen with the Kong crate as shown in the pictures. I could easily monitor my puppy’s actions while working in the same room. Since I live in the 3rd floor, I’ve placed pee pads in the corner and he tends do his business there. With AC running in the room, toys, food and water inside the playpen; he hardly whines unless he wants to go out for potty. This is quite spacious for puppies to grow until they’re house trained.
customer_reviews.author: Vegito_Blue

customer_reviews.title: I clip 5 of these together for camping
customer_reviews.text: I store 5 of these in my 5th wheel storage and use them every camping trip. Two 24” tall and three 36” tall. I have 2018 Jayco 30.5CKTS. The two 24” I place along side RV and I slide one behind my RV steps. The three 36” i connect in a circle pattern. I clip all together. So when my two 7lb dogs want outside, I just open the door. And I don’t have to constantly leash on and off, on and off when ever they want out. They enjoy camping a lot more, and so do we. We sit in our chairs outside and I throw toys. They can also squirt in grass if needed.
customer_reviews.author: JLW

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, very helpful
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I have ordered and its very useful! I use it to keep my pups in one place inside my home when its to cold outside, it does stand on its own however if you have pups that are playful and will jump on the fencing this might not be for you. My dogs are very relaxed and dont jump to much so I simply set the cage up in a circle and its fine however it does help to place it against a will on put something heavy like a case of water so they dont push it down. Overall love the item!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Temporary Foster Kitten Cage
customer_reviews.text: Used to keep some semi-feral kittens we trapped, fixed, and now are looking for homes for. VERY IMPORTANT to place heavy boards over the top because baby cats and dogs love to climb. This would not hold feral adult cats for TNR, but worked to keep these guys separated from our own cat as we attempt to get them and their mother off the street or at least vaccinated, microchipped, and fixed. Four fewer street cats having babies equals many fewer strays a few years in the future. PS- if anyone is wondering in the video why the babies are on being kept on cold cement it's cuz their blankie was in the dryer lol
customer_reviews.author: Iliana

customer_reviews.title: Love this kennel!!!
customer_reviews.text: He already destroyed the couch, but everything else is safe now! This kennel is the bomb! Our puppy, who's half the size of a newborn foal, respects this kennel. He sleeps in it at night, and if we are gone during the day, he willingly enters it and sleeps on his favorite blanket with his chew toys. I caught one of our other dogs enjoying it too. So easy to put together! You basically just unfold it! I wish everything were this easy to set up! Thank you, MidWest Homes for Pets!!!
customer_reviews.author: Honestly

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for rabbits.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in the 30" height for my Lionhead rabbit. It's the perfect height for him. He can chill on top of his hidey box without my worrying about him jumping over. We also have taken it outside in the cool of the evening to let him play and graze a little, and it was very easy to move. I have it in the octagonal shape, with 2 panels folded up to fit my space. This would even work wonderfully for my mini lop if he wasn't free roam (he even seems to like it, as he tried to claim it before the Lionhead!) It's fairly sturdy, and the gate works nicely.
customer_reviews.author: SwtNdSpcy

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised!
customer_reviews.text: Oh my gosh, what in the world took me so long to get one of these. We have now used it visiting friends homes, camping, sitting on the front porch (dogs on the lawn), and at the park. My tenacious dachshunds are safe and I am free to go about the important business of picnicking, camping, visiting, reading, grilling, etc. They have full view of their surroundings and do not feel confined. Very easy to assemble and disassemble. A tad heavy, but so worth the peace of mind that comes from knowing it is more than sturdy enough This is a good one!
customer_reviews.author: Bobbart

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!!!
customer_reviews.text: The first one I received arrived broken with a few brackets missing but Amazon was quick to rectify that and sent me another!!! Thankfully the second one I received was great, sturdy, easy to assemble in backyard. I use it to keep my pets confined while in the backyard and giving them time outside as well. It deters them from going further that's for sure. I highly recommend. I'll probably consider buying another one to expand the space they have
customer_reviews.author: judy

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, configurable, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to set up. We started with it completely open, then reconfigured it to an L shape. She sleeps on one side. Has food and water in the L bend. And does her business at the other end. I've had it for about 2 months. Our chihuahua terrier mix is 3 months old and about 6 lbs. It's still doing a good job of containing her. Our one current concern is that she jumps against the side when shes excited. We're working to stop the behavior but we see the potential for her to get a leg caught and hurt in the openings on her way back down in her jump. But the structure is sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: BLoometta

customer_reviews.title: good for smaller dogs
customer_reviews.text: I used several of these pens together to create a small fenced area next to my house/porch for my small dogs when they go outside. The ground anchors provided do not work great. I purchased plastic posts to make the fence sturdier- just pushed them into the ground and then zip-tied to these fence panels. It also helps to zig-zag the fence a little bit, rather than running it in a completely straight line. I waited until these panels were on sale and added gradually to my fence. I was able to get it put together at a reasonable cost and it works well for my small dogs. Probably not sturdy enough for large or forceful dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Janet/ Kindle Customer

product_meta.title: MidWest Homes for Pets Folding Metal Exercise Pen / Pet Playpen
product_meta.description: The metal Exercise Pen / Pet Playpen by MidWest Homes for Pets provides a great enclosure to keep your pet safe and secure while indoors or outside. These Exercise Pens / Pet Playpens are made of durable metal wire that features a black E-coat finish for long lasting protection against rust and the elements. The black Exercise Pen / Pet Playpen by MidWest Homes for Pets consists of 8 - 24" wide panels and is available in 5 different heights. When fully expanded, the Exercise Pen / Pet Playpen provides your pet with 16 square feet of enclosed living area. Each durable metal Exercise Pen / Pet Playpen is simple to set up (no tools required) and includes 8 ground stakes for secure set-up while being used outdoors and 4 thumb-snaps for easy assembly. These versatile Exercise Pens / Pet Playpens can be used for a variety of pets and fold flat for convenient storage when not in use. Make sure to check out the additional Sunscreen or Wire Mesh Top for the Exercise Pen / Pet Playpen if you want to add additional security or shade to the pen when using it outdoors. As always, MidWest Homes for Pets stands behind the quality of our products with a 1 year Manufacturer's Warranty.
feature_bullets: Each panel measures 24"W x 24"H, Exercise Pen / pet Playpen folds flat for convenient storage
Exercise Pen provides 16 square feet enclosed area (1.5 meters) for your dog & other pets; Dogs upto 25 pounds
8 ground anchors for outdoor use and 4 thumb snaps for easy assembly Included with Exercise Pen / pet Playpen
Durable black E coat finish, provides long lasting protection, features secure double latch door
Easy set up ; No tools required for assembly; Exercise Pen includes 1 year manufacturer's warranty

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
